The girl's Jockey falls in love with the girl and tries to dissuade her from accepting the princely reward.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he holds about the agricultural, and his ideals in regards to human nature, which was featured in his poems and publications up to his days. This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africans. The problems they have are immense, and only solutions of varying degree are contemplated and implemented. The movie is as dark and depressing as the Apartheid period, really, but the light of the hope made by Desmond Tutu and his efforts for reconciliation in the reunion of the divided nation literally shone throughout

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as "Hardcore" (1979) by Paul Bartel but it was pretty bad when compared with this French masterpiece.
